conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Dose Interruption
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) level that triggers temporary dose interruption.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Discontinuation
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) level that triggers permanent discontinuation of study drug.

conditions.name: Neutropenia for Dose Reduction
conditions.description: Neutrophil count decrease that triggers a dose reduction.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury for Interruption
conditions.description: Combination of bilirubin and ALT elevation indicative of liver injury that triggers temporary dose interruption.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening that triggers an evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of psychiatric worsening that triggers an evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Titration
conditions.description: A safety review must be completed before dose titration can occur.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: Condition allowing for an adaptive extension of the outpatient period.
conditions.text: The Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration Hold
transitionRules.text: Participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study if there are safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: Temporary interruption of dosing for ALT > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: Reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD for Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: Discontinuation of study intervention for ALT > 5 × ULN.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a serious hypersensitivity reaction.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a severe uncontrolled infection.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for use of disallowed medication.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site after documented attempts.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point prior to Day 29 to determine if a participant can be titrated from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day based on a review of safety data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Safety Monitoring Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing assessment of safety parameters (liver function, blood counts, neurologic and psychiatric status) that may trigger dose modification or discontinuation at any time during the study.
